news.title: ‘It would create a highly undesirable precedent’ – JP Magnier’s plans to demolish farm buildings refused following appeal
news.summary: Plans by JP Magnier to demolish derelict farm buildings in Co Tipperary have been refused by An Coimisiún Pleanála following an appeal.

news.title: Jim Gavin will need civil servants to guide him on Áras role if he becomes president, says Leo Varadkar
news.summary: Jim Gavin will need help from civil servants on the political and legal aspects of the role if he becomes president, Leo Varadkar has said.

news.title: EU Commission proposes sanctioning Israel and suspending free-trade agreement over Gaza war
news.summary: The European Commission on Wednesday proposed to suspend free-trade arrangements on Israeli goods due to the war in Gaza, even though the measure does not currently have sufficient support among the European Union's member countries to pass.

news.title: Conor McGregor has less than a month to respond to lawsuit alleging sex assault in US
news.summary: Former UFC champion Conor McGregor has less than a month to respond to a civil lawsuit claiming he allegedly sexually assaulted a woman in the US.

news.title: Trump visit: UK and US strike tech deal as US president arrives for state visit
news.summary: Britain and the US have struck a tech deal that could bring billions of pounds of investment to the UK as President Donald Trump arrived for his second state visit.

news.title: My self-build story: ‘The design and lightweight materials meant I could work away myself. It was just me, a ladder and a single-storey log cabin’
news.summary: Could you live in a mobile home for five years while your dream home was being built? If so, you could live in one for up to five years at a time.

news.title: Chef JP McMahon: ‘Americans will spend €500 or €600 and leave zero tip because they’ve been told Ireland doesn’t have a tipping culture’
news.summary: Opening your first restaurant as the world plunges into economic meltdown likely isn’t the most stress-free way to go about things, but that’s the hand that JP McMahon was dealt back in 2008 when he brought Cava Bodega to life in Galway.

news.title: ‘We decided to go for it on a night out at Christmas’ – three women on their first time competing at the Ploughing
news.summary: Throughout the National Ploughing Championships site, there are things far more industrial than agricultural.

news.title: After a shock exit, Traitors suspects buckle amidst tears, treachery and naive trust
news.summary: Warning: Contains spoilers for ‘The Traitors Ireland’

news.title: Virtual insanity: The world that Europe’s Ryder Cup players will be living in when they go to Bethpage
news.summary: No golfer needed a thicker skin playing in America than Colin Montgomerie. That he finished a brilliant career with 31 wins in Europe and eight Order of Merits, but without a single victory on the PGA Tour, seems hardly the work of coincidence.
